title: Video Rogue wave causes chaos on California coastline - ABC News
text:
Rogue wave causes chaos on California coastline
A rogue wave crashed over a Ventura seawall on Thursday, flooding the area and sending at least eight people to the hospital.

author: Tony Pipitone
title: Days appear numbered for Miami Beach hostel housing homeless
text:
A hostel turned largely into a homeless shelter in Miami Beach could soon be demolished â€“ and neighbors could not be happier.
The development comes as a developer cut a deal with the owner of the Bikini Hostel to buy the property.
Watch NBC6 free wherever you are
 WATCH HERE
That move prompted the Miami Beach city commission last week to unanimously approve the developerâ€™s request to move forward with plans to build a taller condo than current zoning allows across West Avenue from the hostel.
Long before it became home to more than 100 homeless people displaced from a shelter in Miami, neighbors along West Avenue and 13th Street say Bikini Hostelâ€™s sometimes noisy, party atmosphere had been a nuisance.
Get local news you need to know to start your day with NBC 6's News Headlines newsletter.
SIGN UP
The deal between the owners of the hostel and the JDS Development Group, looking to expand its real estate empire across the street, could make almost everyone happy.
When it came to the homeless people winding up there, JDSâ€™ CEO Michael Stern wanted city commissioners to know this:
â€œI want to make it clear that we had utterly nothing to do with it,â€ he said at last weekâ€™s meeting. â€œWe were burdened with this problem by bad actors, and if this deal gets approved, it will end up costing us tens of millions of dollars.â€
Thatâ€™s how much he could wind up paying to buy the hostel property, a deal one commissioner said would allow Stern to charge more for each of the 100 to 125 units planned for the 330-foot-tall condo he wants to build across the street.
â€œI really doubt that Mr. Stern, that JDS, that the development team would be able to sell these units for what they're going to be asking for if they had to say that they had a homeless shelter in front of these multi-million-dollar luxury units,â€ said Commissioner Alex Fernandez.
The discussion produced much talk of win-wins.
â€œTo me, what's being presented here, with the elimination of the Bikini Hostel, is actually a public benefit,â€ said fellow commissioner David Suarez.
The commissionâ€™s unanimous support of Sternâ€™s request is the first step on a road to oblivion for the Bikini Hostel -- a longtime goal of its neighbors.
â€œMost importantly, Mr. Stern is buying the Bikini Hostel,â€ one director of a nearby condominium told commissioners. â€œWhen I heard that he was going to do this, I started to cry. The Bikini Hostel has been a scourge and a blight on the West Avenue neighborhood for 15 years now.â€
Added another neighbor: â€œIt's dangerous for the residents, it's dangerous for children, it creates an unsafe environment, and it's been growing worse and worse over time. The demolition of the Bikini Hostel is imperative.â€
How dangerous the homeless made it is not clear from police calls in the area since they were shipped to the hostel in November.
NBC6 Investigates found the number of police calls for crimes and serious quality of life issues in the area actually fell slightly, by about 3%, in the months afterwards, compared to the same months a year earlier. One reason could be the round-the-clock presence of a Miami Beach Police unit outside the building, costing the city more than $1,000 a day.
The hostel was not violating laws or zoning ordinances in housing up to 117 people in its fewer than 20 small rooms stacked with bunk beds, but thereâ€™s no doubt their presence unnerved neighbors.
â€œIt has created a perception of safety concerns in West Avenue,â€ said Commissioner Fernandez. â€œIt's drawn just endless complaints from the neighbors. And frankly, the city doesn't have the $20 million it would take to buy and repurpose the property.â€
But developer Stern does.
â€œWe would be thrilled if the city could solve this issue on its own,â€ he said, â€œbut we are unaware of any mechanism to make that happen.â€
So he made his deal to buy the hostel, demolish it as soon as September and give the land to the city two months after his company receives permission to start occupying the condo building he hopes to complete in 2030.
As for the homeless, the hostel owners have agreed to use at least $1 million from the sale to purchase a property in Miami where they and others in need can be relocated.
An attorney for the hostel owners told NBC6 the deal â€œrepresents a constructive and humane solution, demonstrating how the private sector and local government can work together to solve intractable social problems while preserving constitutional rights.â€
Stern and his lawyers did not return calls or emails seeking comment.
The commission still must approve the development agreement and finalize the zoning changes.
But as last weekâ€™s vote was unanimous, it looks like the days of the Bikini Hostel and the complaints it generates are numbered.

author: Team Reports
title: Basketball Recap: Melissa's Winning Streak Snapped at Six Games
text:
Cardinals
Previous 5 Games
After flying high against Denison last Friday, Melissa came back down to earth. The Melissa Cardinals fell 64-56 to the Lovejoy Leopards on Tuesday. The Cardinals' defeat signaled the end of their six-game winning streak.
Melissa's loss ended a four-game streak of away wins and brought them to 16-12. As for Lovejoy, the win (which was their 11th in a row) raised their record to 24-5.
Melissa and Lovejoy should be looking forward to their upcoming games as both have a sizable advantage in the MaxPreps Texas Rankings. Melissa will square off against McKinney North at 8:00 p.m. on Friday up 339 places (87 vs. 426). Melissa is looking to tack on another W to their four-game streak on the road. Meanwhile, Lovejoy (ranked 51st) will meet Greenville (ranked 616th) at 7:30 p.m. on Friday.

author: John F. Thies
title: Notre Dame Undermines Catholic Mission In Pursuit Of DEI
text:
Posted By: earlybird,
2/21/2025 4:32:45 PM
The University of Notre Dame has been on a decades-long warpath of undermining its Catholic mission at the altar of diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) ideology. But that drive could be on a collision course with the Trump administrationâ€™s threat to revoke federal funding from DEI schools. Just before the Jan. 20 inauguration of President Donald Trump, Notre Dame Provost John McGreevy sent a faculty-wide email stating that the hiring priorities of the school were to increase â€œthe number of women and underrepresented minoritiesâ€ and that those DEI goals were â€œequally importantâ€ to hiring Catholic faculty.
topics: Religion and Belief->relations between religion and government

author: @everyeye
title: Questa missione spaziale costÃ² milioni, ma un trattino mancante mando tutto in malora
text:
9
Nel 1962, la NASA lanciÃ² la sonda Mariner 1 con lâ€™ambizioso obiettivo di raggiungere Venere e compiere la prima esplorazione planetaria americana.
Tuttavia, lâ€™emozione di questo lancio fu di breve durata: a causa di un piccolo errore nel codice, il Mariner 1 finÃ¬ fuori rotta di oltre 100.000 miglia, obbligando gli ingegneri a distruggere il razzo per evitare un possibile impatto con lâ€™oceano Atlantico. Il problema? Un trattino mancante nel software di guida.
La missione Mariner 1 faceva parte del [programma della NASA per la conquista dello spazio](https://tech.everyeye.it/articoli/speciale-mariner-pioneer-origini-esplorazione-spaziale-59281.html) durante la Guerra Fredda, un periodo in cui lâ€™America e lâ€™Unione Sovietica erano in competizione per raggiungere per prime nuovi traguardi ([la Russia ci riuscÃ¬ ed ecco perchÃ© il pianeta Ã¨ considerato russo](https://tech.everyeye.it/notizie/-venere-pianeta-russia-secondo-agenzia-spaziale-russa-469741.html)).
La sonda, costruita in tempi record dal Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), era programmata per raccogliere dati sul clima e le radiazioni magnetiche di Venere, ma poco dopo il decollo il razzo cominciÃ² a deviare dalla traiettoria prevista.
Dopo giorni di analisi, si scoprÃ¬ che la causa dellâ€™errore era un trattino mancante nel codice scritto per il sistema di guida della sonda. Questo piccolo errore, che sembrava quasi insignificante, fece interpretare alla sonda dati errati, portandola fuori rotta e causando il fallimento dellâ€™intera missione.
Lâ€™incidente, oltre a costare allâ€™America una missione interplanetaria e milioni di dollari, rappresentÃ² una lezione fondamentale per la NASA, che da allora si impegnÃ² a migliorare i controlli sui software per evitare che errori minimi potessero compromettere missioni spaziali cruciali.
[Fire TV Stick 4K Max di Amazon Ã¨ uno dei piÃ¹ venduti oggi su ](https://www.amazon.it/dp/B0CW4HD359?tag=notizie_tech-21)
Questo testo include collegamenti di affiliazione: se effettui un acquisto o un ordine attraverso questi collegamenti, il nostro sito potrebbe ricevere una commissione in linea con la nostra [pagina etica](https://www.everyeye.it/advertising/). Le tariffe potrebbero variare dopo la pubblicazione dell'articolo.

Contenuti piÃ¹ Letti

author: Technology Networks
title: Prolonged Immune Signaling May Be Linked to ADHD Development | Technology Networks
text:
New research has linked a key infection-fighting function to hyperactive behavior in mice. News Published: November 22, 2024 | Original story from Duke University Health System
Credit: Tara Winstead/ Pexels
Download Article
Listen with Speechify 0:00
Register for free to listen to this article Thank you. Listen to this article using the player above. âœ–
Want to listen to this article for FREE? Complete the form below to unlock access to ALL audio articles.
âœ– By submitting your email address, you agree to receive email communications related to Technology Networks content, products, or our partners. You may unsubscribe from these communications at any time as we respect your privacy. View our Privacy Policy for more information. Read time: 1 minute
Building on research that has linked immune responses with certain neurobehavioral conditions, researchers at Duke Health have identified how a key infection-fighting function is involved in triggering hyperactive behaviors in mice.
The finding, appearing this month in the journal Brain, Behavior, and Immunity , adds insight to an on-off switch for genes called STAT1. This gene regulator plays a pivotal role in the immune systemâ€™s response to infections and has also been implicated in various neurodevelopmental disorders such as autism and ADHD.
â€œA lot of these pathways that have been discovered in the immune system also play important roles in the brain,â€ said senior author Anthony Filiano , Ph.D., assistant professor in the departments of Neurosurgery and Pathology at Duke University School of Medicine and a faculty member in the Marcus Center for Cellular Cures. â€œThere is a very robust communication between the two systems. This is intriguing because the immune system is very targetable from a therapy perspective.â€
Filiano and colleagues at Duke worked with a team at Columbia University that bred mice with a STAT1 mutation. Using these mice, they were able to over-activate the immune pathway in different cell types of the brain, including dopamine neurons, which help modulate reward, motivation, and motor control.
Want more breaking news? Subscribe to Technology Networks â€™ daily newsletter, delivering breaking science news straight to your inbox every day.
Subscribe for FREE â€œProlonged STAT1 signaling in neurons, beginning during embryonic development, led to hyperactive behavior and fewer neurons and reduced neural activity in an area of the brain involved in learning, memory, reward and motivation,â€ Filiano said. â€œThese results suggest that STAT1 signaling in dopamine neurons has a role in regulating behavior and disruption of this signaling may contribute to neurodevelopmental disorders.â€
Filiano said further studies will explore whether itâ€™s possible to target the STAT1 pathway with therapies: â€œWe need to understand its function and target it more specifically before we move forward,â€ he said.
Reference: Clark DN, Brown SV, Xu L, et al. Prolonged STAT1 signaling in neurons causes hyperactive behavior. Brain, Behav Immun . 2025;124:1-8. doi: 10.1016/j.bbi.2024.11.018
This article has been republished from the following materials . Note: material may have been edited for length and content. For further information, please contact the cited source. Our press release publishing policy can be accessed here .

author: Artem Kamenskyi
title: Victorian Literature: The Corruption of Christianity in Dracula Free Essay Example
text: 24/7 writing help on your phone Save to my list Remove from my list In the 19th century, Christianity suffered a decline of faith. Scientific discoveries and the publication of rational studies of the Bible as a historical book and not as Godâ€™s word, like The life of Jesus (1808-74) from David Strauss, contributed to the decrease of the Christian belief. Moreover, the publication of theories like On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural selection (1859) from Charles Darwin enforced the idea that God was not the Creator. On the other side, the literature of that period reflected a strong fear of foreign invasion by the Victorian society. In this way, Dracula is a novel, which backgroundâ€™s, reflects the fear of the 19th century reader of losing the style of life they knew and the way to establish it as it was before. In the novel, this fear is presented as a foreign monster that perverts the most susceptible being, the women. Many scholars understood the novel as an allegory of non-supernatural issues that occurred at the end of the 19th century. In order to fight Dracula, Christian symbols are used, like crucifixes and communion wafers. The use of this symbols can be seen as hypocrite -due to Victorian societyâ€™s decision to trust in science-. However if we realize that count Dracula is seen as the personification of the Devil, the use of religious symbols and religious rituals must not be strange, symbols of the good forces are used to combat a very dangerous one. According to Steven Herbert, the crucifix â€œsymbolizes the surrender of ego to Spirit so necessary to achieve Wholeness. This powerful archetype embodies the message that the lower nature of man must die first before the Higher nature can be resurrectedâ€ that means, in Landix words, â€œthat the Flesh and the Spirit are conflicting and the crucifix represents the Spirit triumphing over the flesh to achieve eternal salvationâ€. So that the crucifix represents the restoration of their customs and principles. On the other side, an other important point is what the character of Count Dracula really represents. As it is said before, Dracula, in the background, represents a foreign threat that tries to pervert the English society principles. Through the appearance of a demonic creature, with red eyes and fangs, which represents the devil personification. In other words, it represents the fear of the change, either by an external physical threat or the threat of the arrival of new modern ideas that represented the disrupt of their society values and norms. The most susceptible being were women, that were not strong enough to avoid Draculaâ€™s enchantment to avoid being infected, as they are more probable to get pervert with the new modern foreign ideas. Minaâ€™s character represents the perfect Victorian women that follows the patriarchal and religious model, whereas Lucy that do not as soon as she became infected like the three vampire women. They represent independence, erotism and non-maternal feelings and behaviour that are not well seen in the Victorian times. Mina represents the patriarchal middle class model, she is sweet and domesticated. She does not let the vampire pervert her and fight against it. Unfortunately, when Lucy becomes infected the only way to be saved was through death. As she became a night creature, only the use of Christian symbols and rituals employed by the perfect Anglican men could save her soul from the eternity. In the novel, despite the use of Christian symbols, the constant use of pagan symbols are justified and necessary in order to get rid of the threat that vampirism implies. However, despite the combination of these factors it is important to follow the Christian and patriarchal perfect model, mostly the women. An example of this situation can be seen in chapter XXVII, when Mina is tempted to choose vampirism by the three women that tries to seduce her with her provocative and hypnotize voice, but she prefers to follow the patriarchal role model: â€œThey smiled ever at poor dear Madam Mina, and as their laugh came through the silence of the night, they twined their arms and pointed her, and said in those so sweet tingling tones that Jonathan said were of the intolerable sweetness of the water. Glasses: â€œCome sister. Come to us. Come! Come!â€ In fear I turner to my poor ooh Madam Mina and my heart with gladness leapt like flame, for oh! the terror in her sweet eyes, the repulsion, the horror, told a story to my heart that was all of hope. God be thanked she was not, yet, one of them.â€ In the last part of the novel, in Jonathanâ€™s notes, Christianity is more present than ever: â€œWe want no proofs, we ask none to believe us! This boy will some day know what a brave and gallant woman his mother is. Already he knows her sweetness and loving care, later on he will understand how some men so loved her, that they did dare much for her sake.â€In this passage, Van Helsing is elevating Mina as the category of a Saint that could maintain herself pure to take into account the most important labour in a womanâ€™s life give birth to a child that will continue with the Patriarchal an Cristian principles. In conclusion, Christianity in the novel is used, jointly with occultism factors, to fight the dangerous foreign threat that Count Dracula represent. Along the novel, Christian values are always present and the way to be saved and do not become pervert is to follow them and do not move away. However, we should not forget that the threat that Count Dracula supposes is hidden by a fear of being invaded with new ideas that represent the perfect patriarchal Anglican model. ðŸ‘‹ Hi! Iâ€™m your smart assistant Amy! Donâ€™t know where to start? Type your requirements and Iâ€™ll connect you to an academic expert within 3 minutes.

author: @ChristianPost
title: Gateway Church joins local response to deadly Texas flood
text:
Gateway Church joins local response to deadly Texas flood
Gateway Church in Southlake, Texas, joined multiple churches and relief agencies Wednesday in responding to the devastating flooding in the Texas Hill Country that has killed at least 120 people, while another 172 remain missing since last Friday.
In a statement provided to The Christian Post, Gateway Church leaders said they launched crisis relief efforts as soon as they became aware of the tragedy. They called on their community to give and pray. The response was overwhelming, they said.
"Gateway family and community â€” in response to the devastating floods that swept through Central Texas on the Fourth of July, you've taken action and your generosity has been incredible," the church noted in a statement on Facebook Wednesday, along with a video message from executive pastor, Nic Lesmeister.
"Thank you for responding with compassion and quick action by giving generously to support those affected by the flooding. We ask that you join us in continuing to pray for every victim, their families, and the first responders serving tirelessly in the aftermath."
Lesmeister said Gateway Church will be directing flood relief donations to "trusted ministries that have been approved by the state of Texas" to work in the affected areas.
The church further told CP that funding had been distributed directly to Mercy Chefs, a faith-based nonprofit disaster relief organization that provides professionally prepared, restaurant-quality meals to victims, volunteers, and first responders in the wake of natural disasters.
Camp Mystic, a private Christian summer camp for girls located along the Guadalupe River, which has been in operation since 1926, remains among the areas hardest hit by the flood.
At least 27 attendees and counselors from the camp are either dead or missing. Another five campers and a counselor are still unaccounted for, Kerr County Sheriff Larry Leitha said.
Scott and Katie Fineske, who own and direct the all-boys Camp La Junta in Hunt, Texas, thanked God that no one from their camp died during the flood but grieve for the victims at Camp Mystic.
"We are profoundly grateful that every boy at Camp La Junta is safe, yet our hearts are heavy," they said in a statement, cited by ABC News. "We grieve with the families of the Camp Mystic girls and with everyone affected by this tragedy, including our dear friends, Dick Eastland and Jane Ragsdale."
Ragsdale, the director of the Heart O' the Hills Camp for Girls, and Eastland, the longtime director of Camp Mystic, both died in the flooding.
The Fineskes said that when the floodwaters crossed their camp's main field on Friday morning, "our team moved cabin-by-cabin to higher ground and confirmed, through repeated headcounts, that every camper and staff member was accounted for."
They learned later that day of the Camp Mystic deaths, which shook their entire community.
While state officials investigate what went wrong, many other churches, such as Park Cities Baptist Church in Dallas, have also stepped forward to help flood victims.
"In response to the recent devastating flooding in Kerr County and across the Hill Country, the PCBC Missions Committee has designated $10,000 to Texans on Mission to support their ongoing relief efforts for those impacted by this tragedy," the church announced Wednesday. "If you feel led to be the hands and feet of Jesus in this time of need, opportunities to serve are available at texansonmission.org/serve."
Members of Gateway Church and leaders in Southlake have also joined together to provide prayer and support for families impacted by the floods in Kerr County. Gateway Church is also helping cover critical crisis needs, including rebuilding efforts, funeral expenses, and emergency aid for displaced families.
Contact: leonardo.blair@christianpost.com Follow Leonardo Blair on Twitter: @leoblair Follow Leonardo Blair on Facebook: LeoBlairChristianPost
